DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I don't have any requests.
RESPONSE TEXT: Better for the both of us. Unless you like waiting, of course.
Mister DeLuca has good intentions, but let's just say his ability to prioritize is a bit lacking.
I believe it has something to do with his sobriety.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds like a typical boss to me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: This Vault is a mess.
RESPONSE TEXT: I couldn't agree more, but believe me, it's not from lack of trying.
SCRIPT NOTES: Gossipy tone, feeling is mutual. / Conspiratorial

RESPONSE TEXT: If only Mister DeLuca would allow me to assist with general maintenance and cleanliness more often.
But I believe he prefers to keep me reserved for his own needs, and those of his sister, of course.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds like a typical boss to me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: So you're programmed for Vault maintenance.
RESPONSE TEXT: An astute observation.
I assist Mister DeLuca with reactor maintenance, tending to the heart of the Vault.
SCRIPT NOTES: Friendly explanation of his job. / Friendly

RESPONSE TEXT: He prefers to supervise while giving me the privilege of fulfilling the tasks.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds like a typical boss to me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Staying pretty busy these days?
RESPONSE TEXT: Quite so. Mister DeLuca has made it his life's work to occupy my time.
Not only do I specialize in reactor maintenance, but now I am trained in doing his laundry, fetching libations, and generally picking up after him.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: Sounds like a typical boss to me.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Sounds like a typical boss to me.
RESPONSE TEXT: It's a relief to hear you say so. Compared to his predecessor, Mister DeLuca has very little mechanical knowledge.
I almost thought him unqualified, but when it comes to delegation, he's top notch.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Mister DeLuca sounds like he prefers slacking off to actual work.
RESPONSE TEXT: Ah yes, I've heard those very words repeated by several citizens of the Vault. However, they should be grateful.
Mister DeLuca's knowledge of reactors is limited at best. It's really better he remains "hands off".

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I don't know. He sounds pretty selfish to me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Codswallop. Mister DeLuca ensures I tend to his sister's every need as well. He is quite generous when it comes to her.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: I don't know. He sounds pretty selfish to me.
RESPONSE TEXT: Codswallop. Mister DeLuca used to make sure I tended to his late sister's every need as well. He was quite generous when it came to her.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Player Default: Does he help out with any of the work?
RESPONSE TEXT: If memory serves, the last bit of work he performed was when Mister Whitaker forced him to clean up the supply room.
He was also quite vocal about his distaste for the job.

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Tina: Oh, you've been working? Sure. I bet bossing around Old Rusty really takes it out of you.
RESPONSE TEXT: You've no idea, Miss DeLuca.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Bobby: Hey, will you both just get lost? You're killing my buzz here.
SCRIPT NOTES: Sarcastic - Listening to two people fight, side commenting. / Sarcastic

DIALOGUE BEFORE: Bobby: Hey, will you both just get lost? You're killing my buzz here.
RESPONSE TEXT: With pleasure, sir.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Tina: Fine. Get caught. Then you won't have the choice to leave because the Overseer will make it for you.
SCRIPT NOTES: More than happy to leave. / Sarcastic

RESPONSE TEXT: Please direct any maintenance requests to Mister DeLuca. They will be handled in the order they were received.
DIALOGUE AFTER: Player Default: I don't have any requests.

RESPONSE TEXT: Mister DeLuca, I'm lacking specific orders at the moment. You might want to take care of that. Mister DeLuca? Are you listening? Oh dear.
I've cleaned up around here as you requested. Although as usual, I'm a bit confused by the "and shit" part of your request.
Sorry to be a bother, ma'am, but I'm lacking specific orders at the moment. You might want to see to that.
Your room is picked up as best I can, Miss DeLuca. I really do wish you'd let me do more in there. Maybe even organize a drawer or two.
Those repairs are all finished. Everything is right as rain. Not that it rains in the Vault mind you.
SCRIPT NOTES: self satisfied with his efforts. / Grateful

RESPONSE TEXT: It appears that I am out of things to do. I guess I'll wander the halls, looking for things to fix. All by myself. Just me. Wandering the halls.
Is it a little crowded in here, or is it just me?
Excuse my extremities.
Pardon me.
Why, if it isn't the devious outsider. Haven't you done enough?
Mister DeLuca may have been a prize winning laggard, but he bloody well didn't deserve to die.
Oh, it's you. I suppose I've you to thank for Miss DeLuca's stellar attitude of late.
Haven't you another soul to corrupt somewhere?
A word of advice, stay away from kiddies. You're not exactly the role model material they need at their age.
I must say, since Mr. DeLuca cleaned up his act, my life has become ten times more bearable.
Now that Mr. DeLuca has cleaned up his act, perhaps he'd learn to clean up after himself as well.
I suppose I've you to thank for Mr. DeLuca's renewed interest in my work.
It's quite the change you've brought over Mr. DeLuca. And for the better, if I may add.
I haven't seen Mr. DeLuca this well since he was a toddler.
I'm sorry, but I've no time for idle chatter.
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight disdain, not a fan of the player / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Ah, the meddler. Don't you have some lives to ruin?
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight disdain, not a fan of the player / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Oh, it's you.
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight disdain, not a fan of the player / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Shouldn't you be elsewhere?
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight disdain, not a fan of the player / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: Still here, I see.
SCRIPT NOTES: Slight disdain, not a fan of the player / Disgust

RESPONSE TEXT: It's a shame how quickly drugs can turn one to violence.
Robert DeLuca was a kind soul. Had he been of sound mind, he never would have hurt you.
SCRIPT NOTES: Reassuring the player and defending his past master / Somber

RESPONSE TEXT: Poor Mister DeLuca. He was hardly himself when he died.
I fear Miss DeLuca is quite distraught over the loss of her twin.
Please accept my humblest apologies that you had to see such a dark side of Mister DeLuca.
